category: Member sport group regulations/Article 27 (Resignation and dismissal of executives)
contents: Article 27 (Resignation and dismissal of executives) ① If an executive other than the chairman resigns, he or she must submit a letter of resignation to the chairman or his acting representative. If the chairman resigns, he or she must submit a resignation letter to the secretariat. If an executive submits a letter of resignation, he or she is deemed to have resigned upon submission. ② If a member sport organization is designated as a management organization pursuant to Article 12, Paragraph 1 of the Articles of Incorporation, the executives of the organization shall be dismissed immediately after designation. Revised on March 23, 2017. ③ If an executive falls under any of the following items, he or she shall be deemed to have retired. Amended 2017. 3. 23., 2017. 8. 7., 2018. 4. 25., 2019. 12. 20., 2020. 7. 29., 2021. 10. 6. 1. In Article 22 (9) 2. A person whose approval has been canceled or withdrawn from the Sports Council 2. When he/she falls under Article 26 (1) to (3) or is found to fall under the same at the time of appointment 3. A city/provincial sports organization, an executive of a national federation, or a sports organization 4. When a person who represents and becomes an executive is dismissed or resigns from the organization; 4. When the period of acting on behalf of the chairman exceeds 6 months due to an accident.
